items.title: US sanctions Russian broker for buying stolen zero-day exploits
items.description: The U.S. Treasury Department has sanctioned a Russian exploit broker who bought stolen hacking tools from a former executive of a U.S. defense contractor. [...]

items.title: Claude’s New AI Vulnerability Scanner Sends Cybersecurity Shares Plunging
items.description: The stocks of major cybersecurity companies have fallen sharply over fears that AI is disrupting the industry. The post Claude’s New AI Vulnerability Scanner Sends Cybersecurity Shares Plunging appeared first on SecurityWeek.

items.title: Defense Contractor Employee Jailed for Selling 8 Zero-Days to Russian Broker
items.description: A 39-year-old Australian national who was previously employed at U.S. defense contractor L3Harris has been sentenced to a little over seven years in prison for selling eight zero-day exploits to Russian exploit broker Operation Zero in exchange for millions of dollars. Peter Williams pleaded guilty

items.title: Ex-L3Harris exec jailed for selling zero-days to Russian exploit broker
items.description: The former head of Trenchant, a specialized U.S. defense contractor unit, was sentenced Tuesday to more than seven years in federal prison for stealing and selling zero-day exploits to a Russian broker whose clients include the Russian government. [...]

items.title: SolarWinds Patches 4 Critical Serv-U 15.5 Flaws Allowing Root Code Execution
items.description: SolarWinds has released updates to address four critical security flaws in its Serv-U file transfer software that, if successfully exploited, could result in remote code execution. The vulnerabilities, all rated 9.1 on the CVSS scoring system, are listed below - CVE-2025-40538 - A broken access cont

items.title: CISA Confirms Active Exploitation of FileZen CVE-2026-25108 Vulnerability
items.description: The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) on Tuesday added a recently disclosed vulnerability in FileZen to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, citing evidence of active exploitation. The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2026-25108 (CVSS v4 score: 8.7), is a case o

items.title: Phishing campaign targets freight and logistics orgs in the US, Europe
items.description: A financially motivated threat group dubbed "Diesel Vortex" is stealing credentials from freight and logistics operators in the U.S. and Europe in phishing attacks using 52 domains. [...]

items.title: Wynn Resorts confirms employee data breach after extortion threat
items.description: Wynn Resorts has confirmed that a hacker stole employee data from its systems after the company was listed on the ShinyHunters extortion gang's data leak site. [...]

items.title: RoguePilot Flaw in GitHub Codespaces Enabled Copilot to Leak GITHUB_TOKEN
items.description: A vulnerability in GitHub Codespaces could have been exploited by bad actors to seize control of repositories by injecting malicious Copilot instructions in a GitHub issue. The artificial intelligence (AI)-driven vulnerability has been codenamed RoguePilot by Orca Security. It has since been patched

items.title: CarGurus data breach exposes information of 12.4 million accounts
items.description: The ShinyHunters extortion group has published personal information in more than 12 million records allegedly stolen from CarGurus, a U.S.-based digital auto platform. [...]

items.title: Identity-First AI Security: Why CISOs Must Add Intent to the Equation
items.description: AI agents now provision infrastructure and approve actions, but many inherit over-scoped privileges without proper governance. Token Security explains why CISOs must treat agents as identities and add intent-based controls so access is granted only when purpose and context align. [...]

items.title: VMware Aria Operations Vulnerability Could Allow Remote Code Execution
items.description: Broadcom has patched several vulnerabilities in VMware Aria Operations, including high-severity flaws. The post VMware Aria Operations Vulnerability Could Allow Remote Code Execution appeared first on SecurityWeek.

items.title: Taiwan Security Firm Confirms Flaw Flagged by CISA Likely Exploited by Chinese APTs
items.description: The vulnerability in TeamT5 ThreatSonar Anti-Ransomware was recently added to CISAâ€™s KEV catalog. The post Taiwan Security Firm Confirms Flaw Flagged by CISA Likely Exploited by Chinese APTs appeared first on SecurityWeek.

items.title: ShinyHunters extortion gang claims Odido breach affecting millions
items.description: The ShinyHunters extortion gang has claimed responsibility for breaching Dutch telecommunications provider Odido and stealing millions of user records from its compromised systems. [...]

items.title: Android mental health apps with 14.7M installs filled with security flaws
items.description: Several mental health mobile apps with millions of downloads on Google Play contain security vulnerabilities that could expose users' sensitive medical information. [...]

items.title: APT28 Targeted European Entities Using Webhook-Based Macro Malware
items.description: The Russia-linked state-sponsored threat actor tracked as APT28 has been attributed to a new campaign targeting specific entities in Western and Central Europe. The activity, per S2 Grupo's LAB52 threat intelligence team, was active between September 2025 and January 2026. It has been codenamed Oper

items.title: Wormable XMRig Campaign Uses BYOVD Exploit and Time-Based Logic Bomb
items.description: Cybersecurity researchers have disclosed details of a new cryptojacking campaign that uses pirated software bundles as lures to deploy a bespoke XMRig miner program on compromised hosts. "Analysis of the recovered dropper, persistence triggers, and mining payload reveals a sophisticated, multi-stage

items.title: How Exposed Endpoints Increase Risk Across LLM Infrastructure
items.description: As more organizations run their own Large Language Models (LLMs), they are also deploying more internal services and Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) to support those models. Modern security risks are being introduced less from the models themselves and more from the infrastructure that ser

items.title: Malicious npm Packages Harvest Crypto Keys, CI Secrets, and API Tokens
items.description: Cybersecurity researchers have disclosed what they say is an active "Shai-Hulud-like" supply chain worm campaign that has leveraged a cluster of at least 19 malicious npm packages to enable credential harvesting and cryptocurrency key theft. The campaign has been codenamed SANDWORM_MODE by supply ch

items.title: Anthropic Launches Claude Code Security for AI-Powered Vulnerability Scanning
items.description: Artificial intelligence (AI) company Anthropic has begun to roll out a new security feature for Claude Code that can scan a user's software codebase for vulnerabilities and suggest patches.
